reviews.sentence: Beautiful LA Hotel must stay. love this Hotel delicious food beautiful dining room great pool on roof. Stayed here twice I would stay again. If you enjoy walking in a big city the location of Checkers is just the place. Pleasant staff and comfortable beds.

Heaven. I could not have loved this experience more. Check in was friendly and warm unlike the typical Hilton experience. Anything we needed was taken care of quickly. The room was gorgeous had a great view of the city and access to the rooftop pool deck that was divine in the evenings. My only hang up was the valet and the doorman. The valet was slow and sort of clueless. The doorman was more concerned with talking on the phone and looking angrily at people than welcoming people to the hotel and doing his job. Overall really enjoyed our stay.

Great stay but a few things made it a little off. Have stayed before here so always great place close to LA Live Staples Center for our events. Rooms are big and nice. 1st odd event is all places downtown now have security and at night the security were acting as doorman. I want security out of the way and doorman to be door man. at one point 2 security and 2 door man all in the way. 2nd issue is this hotel had the best pool on the roof top and though we never use the pool it was so nice to sit up on the roof and over look the city. Well now the pool is filled and beach style chairs fill the space but on Saturday night we brought up a few friends to enjoy the view but it was closed for a private partyMore and more hotels are using amenities for extra revenue stream but our bill was no less because if a major amenities we wanted to use was blocked from useNot a big deal just more annoying to have to go to a different hotel The Strand to do what we wanted to do at our hotel we paid forGreat area close to subway lightrail lots of good places to eat and drink seem pretty safe no real issues and we stayed out late. Always a movie or commercials or TV shows being filmed every time we go. Wish the bar was a little more friendly and people focused always seemed empty. Front desk was a little slow so we would call in needs and request. Shower need adjusting and heater did nt work 1st night but fixed the next day. Missing mini bars refrigerators. Over all a great stay but with a few tweaks could have been perfectWould stay again.

A Gem in Downtown Los Angeles. full service hotel with handsome bar and rooftop Jacuzi no pool anymore. corner room was flooded with sunlight and nice views of the city. great location. downtown location close to shops restaurants museums and it is all in walking distance.

Kiss the cook shoot the decorator. I stayed this weekend at the Hilton Checkers hotel. I decided to book the Penthouse because I could get it at a reduced rate due to hotel points. I was so excited to stay there. The location is fabulous right next to the grand Downtown Library. The rooftop terrace was superb and open to all guests spectacular views of downtown a little jacuzi hot pool and elegant furniture. The staff was great and 5 stars plus to the cokI had a bar special Vietnamese Chicken which I highly recommend to anyone who likes spicy hot chicken. Now the negatives the decor in the Penthouse was atrocious. It looked like a cross between a bordello and 1960s Las Vegas gangster. The Penthouse was all black inside the wallpaper black and gold the bedroom gold vinyl textured. The carpet. Black and Tan textured. I could not sleep at all. I do not think there are many guests in the penthouse because there were 3 large moths in it. The handyman killed one I killed the other two during the night. I checked out the first thing next morning. Never Again.

Downtown Urban Jewel. This hotel has a terrific Penthouse featuring a jacuzi chairs for sunbathing and a fantastic view of downtown Los Angeles from about 13 stories up. Conveniently located just one block from the Central Library and Maguire Gardens you are just a 5 minute walk to Pershing Square and Bunker Hill. Upon entering the lobby you will be greeted by a friendly staff when you check in to the Hilton Checkers. The folks at the front desk were very accommodating gladly printing out airline boarding passes for us while we were at the theatre. The restaurant service was quick and efficient and the food was delicious especially the fresh fruit with the Belgian waffles. Our room was clean and tidy albeit a bit small but overall a good value. The front desk was gracious about giving us a 30 minute grace period for checking out past the noon deadlinewe have stayed twice now at the Hilton Checkers and will definitely come back again. Great location. Clean and tidy.

Expect more from a Hilton. Hilton Checkers is a Hilton located in downtown Los Angeles in a renovated building originally built in the 1920s. The property has a small boutique flair with Hilton standards. Rooms are appropriately furnished with the expected firm beds comfortable pillows and soft sheets. Business men seem to be the primary customers. However for some reason throughout my six days stay it seemed that something was not quite right see cons below. The elevators and room has proximity sensor where you put the room key next to operate the elevators or open the door. I expect Hilton properties to meet certain standards and Hilton Checkers fell a bit short. PROs Unique boutique style hotel with character and flair Penthouse on the top floor with a great view overlooking downtown Los Angeles and jacuzi Bar with a great selection of beverages but …. Great gym – Precor equipment 2x Elipticals 1x recumbent bike 3x treadmills. dumbbells from 5 – 50 pounds but … CONs Although the bar has great selection they ran out of the draft IPA on Tuesday only on Thursday did we find out that they were going to replace it with another brand. Service was hit or miss depending upon who was tending the bar. After three nights my buddy and I decided to imbibe elsewhere Although the gym had great equipment ventilation was lacking – when full Monday Tuesday morning stagnant sweaty air permeated throughout the gym. NOT good. Additionally on Wednesday morning there were NO towels in the gym. I walked down to the front desk to inform them and they stated that they would immediately bring some up to the gym. I started my cardio routine … 30 minutes later no towels. UGH Much like the hit or miss service at the bar the front desk service seems fit the same standard hit or miss. I expect a certain level of standard from Hiltons – the certainty is what makes staying in Hilton brand properties automatic. If staying in downtown Los Angeles again I may consider staying across the street at the Biltmore Hotel instead.

Lovely Hotel. I stayed here in July 2015 with a friend and we had a fantastic time. The staff were all super friendly and helpful. We LOVED the roof top area and pool. Found it was a little far away from a few things as we only had 4 days in LA.
Enjoyed the roof top Jacuzi and breakfast in the morning polside on a clear day. Awesome.

Great Hotel but too much money for what you get no pool just a hot tub. If you have other peoples money to spend its great. If you are traveling for business it is great. Not kid friendly and way too much money for what you get. Parking was a huge deal. Expect to spend over 40 for parking and valet.

Bad family stay experience. Would not stay with the family again at this property. Had very bad experience. Bed had musty smell. No bathroom lock. Jacuzi is very small and can not fit more the 4 guests at a time. Temp in souther California drops in night to upper 50s to low 60s. Heating system in the room did not work. When called front desk they sent the valet guy to look at the issue as they did not have technician onsite.

Awesome stay. From check in to check out we were treated like royalty. The valet guys are quick and courteous. Front desk agents are friendly and accommodating. Comfy bed and pillows. The room was extra clean with plenty of towels. The rooftop views are spectacular. There plenty of places to eat within walking distance The only negative thing there is no swimming pool. This truly is a great place to stay.
Lied to by the front desk room service order messed up no outdoor pool despite what the website said indifferent staff.

Great location. Very nice hotel in Downtown LA. Best Cob salad. Hotel itself is bit old but I am sold on Jacuzi on the top. Dinner menu is poor and restaurant closes too soon but the food quality is great. Staff is very friendly and nice.

Only great thing about this place is the location. Not sure how it is rated as a 4 star hotel. Not very many rooms have a view. Most of the rooms you are looking directly at another building. Showers heads are not great feels like there is no water pressure. Amenities are non existent. You get a small jacuzi and small pool on the roof. That pretty much it. In hotel dining is pretty dismal So plan on dining elsewhere.

Business trip but thoroughly enjoyed myself on my off time. I stayed at the Hilton Checkers for business. I was attending the gift shows in the LA Mart and the Hotel provided shuttle service or when I was running late I could grab a taxi very easily and would have a short trip to the Mart. Rooms are fantastic beds are super comfortable. The rooftop pool is wonderful with amazing views of the city. If you like to work out there is a small workout room and quite frankly I never saw anyone in the pool or the workout room. Felt like I had the place to myself. The lobby bar restaurant has an old world feel. Lots of wood comfortable chairs and I was able to meet a colleague for drinks and work quite comfortably.

Beautiful property in desperate need of renovation. Stayed one night. Took advantage of a very inexpensive upgrade to the Penthouse Suite. Room is huge you can really lose yourself in there. The carpets are old and there were many deep scratches on the wooden floors. There is a gas fireplace that actually worked we checked. The room has a door to the outdoor patio but I did n’t like that the patio area is shared with the public patio. I feel the penthouse patio area should have been private. There is also a jacuzi on the top floor public patio but the water was cold. the biggest issue was that we could not figure out how to get the air conditioner to cool the room. The room was 80 degrees I bit warm for me I could n’t sleep. I threw in the towel at 5 am and called the front desk. Staff was sent up and he could n’t figure it out either. Finally decided to open the two windows for a slight relief. Front desk staff at check. in was super delightful. The building is one of the oldest in town according to the staff and supposedly was the tallest building in LA upon opening. However now surrounding buildings tower over it. I went to get breakfast at the restaurant but the staff did n’t seem in to much of a hurry to let me take a peak at a menu so I left. The penthouse would probably be great for a Hangover Type Party as I do n’t see how much harm could be done to the old room. Oh last thing there is a desk in the living space with a spiderweb mix of wires connected to a power strip. Not Penthouse worthy.

My stay was extremely comfortable enjoyable and restful. Bed was super comfortable. I loved the toiletries in the bathroom. The hotel restaurant had a great menu and beverage selection. The staff did not give enough information about the hotel upon check in. For example there was no info about the pool and one night I was surprised that the bar was closed much earlier than the posted hours said it would be. The mini bar also could be better.
Not perfect as advertised. I like area. I did n’t have sopa in my shower not kol.
